akn:section.akn:heading: Regulations for use of video surveillance by Metropolitan Police Department.

akn:content.akn:p: The Chief of Police, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, shall issue regulations pertaining to the Metropolitan Police Departmentâ€™s use of video surveillance cameras and technology in the operation of its Joint Operations Command Center/Synchronized Operations Command Center.
The proposed regulations shall be submitted to the Council for a 45-day period of review, excluding Saturdays, Sundays, legal holidays, and days of Council recess.
If the Council does not approve or disapprove the proposed regulations, in whole or in part, by resolution, within this 45-day review period, the proposed regulations shall be deemed disapproved.
